ygData.subject: Re: The Awakening
ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson turns his ear to Perceptor after hearing what Legacy had to say. He smiles.  I can see how you got your name.  Highly perceptive of you.  Thank you

Tucson turns his ear to Perceptor after hearing what Legacy had to say. He =
smiles.

" I can see how you got your name.  Highly perceptive of you.  Tha=
nk you Legacy, you've shed a lot of light on many of my questions.  Now tha=
t I know my lineage, it's time I lived up to it.  First things first, Perce=
ptor and I could do with getting our sight back, and if you could do that I=
'd greatly appreciate it, Stanton.  Next, we have insectoids hiding beneath=
 the Black Fortress tunnels, which have to be shown a lesson about tamperin=
g with what is not theirs.  And Hydras last of all, could use a lesson in t=
hat as well.  Nobody tampers with any Autobot and gets away with it.  Espec=
ially when they tamper with a Prime."

He turns his head toward Rodimus.

"=
 They caused great harm to you Rodimus, and I'll see to it, with your help,=
 that they get it back in return.  If Optimus Prime could fend off Megatron=
, I'm sure I can follow in his footsteps, and fend off the enemy at hand.  =
Both Hydras and Cylconus need to be dealt with accordingly.  Rodimus voiced=
 an interest in dealing with Hydras and so do I.  Two Primes against an evi=
l leader is sure to topple even the most evil of warlords.  But our war doe=
s not end with just us.  If we're going to send those Decepticons and Predi=
cons packing, we'll need every Autobot and Maximal we have in our ranks to =
pull this off.  Lord Elder, I'd like you to contact Lord Perseus, and assem=
ble a Maximal/ Autobot assembly.  The more we get together, the stronger we=
'll be."

 for a
> moment, "You come from the same construction line as the Autobot
>=

moment as if accessing some internal memories,

g to the last scan record bears a striking

ltra Magnus, Convoy as well as Big
> Convoy. However here are those who pos=
tulate that Spark Matriixes are

he desisions arrived at as
> much as by default construction specifications=
."
>

> s=
ure if that is because that is how you're constructed or because your
> act=
ions have made it that way."
> 
> Legacy glanced at Santon, "I believe I ha=
d already said that." he
> intoned coolly.
> 
> "Yeah, well sometimes your =
words are longer than a class 5 star
> crusier." Santon retorted smoothly.
=
